mn69:2.1: padasamcara or padarasamacara, which seems preferable, is really uncertain, and appears to occur only here. The parallel at MA 26 is not close enough to be directly relevant, but it does confirm the idea of bad behavior.
mn69:4.4: BB follows PTS in having abhisamacarika here. Surely this is a confusion in the text, and the MS version is correct.
mn69:19.1: This seems to be the only occurence of this phrase not given in full. And p[erhaps also the only place where it stands solely for arahantship.
